attributes.value: To play this card, discard 2 of your Lessons from play. Before each of your turns, if there are any Creatures in play, choose 1 of them and discard it. Then, if there are no Creatures in play, discard this card.
Once per game, you may discard your hand and then draw 6 cards.

At the end of each of your turns, if an opponent has more Lessons in play than you, you may search your deck. You may take up to 2 Lessons from your deck, reveal them, put 1 into play and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
Before each of your turns, count the number of Marauder cards you have in your discard pile and in play. Do that much damage to an opponent.

To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Choose an opponent. During their next turn, when you would take any amount of damage, instead do that much damage to them, and whenever they would draw any number of cards, except during their draw step, instead you draw that many cards.
When you play this card, you may choose a player. That player shuffles their hand into their deck and then draws 4 cards.
'...it was definitely a bit bowlegged and its face looked grumpy and oddly squashed, as though it had run headlong into a brick wall.'

When you play this card, choose a Character in play (other than a starting Character) and put it under this card. Cards that share Uniqueness with the chosen card cannot be played.

If this card would leave play, you may instead discard 3 cards from your hand.

You may use an Action and discard a Lesson from your hand. If you do, choose an opponent. During their next turn, they get 1 fewer Action. (If this would mean your opponent has fewer than 1 Action, they still get 1 Action.)

‘“He’s made some changes in the lineup and seems to be going for size rather than skill —”’ 
— Lee Jordan
If you have a Beater, Chaser, Keeper, and Seeker in play, whenever you use an Action to play a Match, you win the Match.

You may use an Action and discard a Lesson from your hand. If you do, choose an opponent. During their next turn, they get 1 fewer Action. (If this would mean your opponent has fewer than 1 Action, they still get 1 Action.)
At the end of each of your turns, you may discard 1 of your Lessons from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a Unique card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
Once per game, you may put up to 5 cards in an opponen's discard pile on the bottom of their deck in any order. Then do that much damage to that opponent.
Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play.
Once per turn, if you have at least 5 Lessons in your discard pile, you may use an Action to put up to 2 non-Advanced Lessons from your discard pile into play.
Before each of your turns, if you have at least 1 Beater, 3 Chasers, 1 Keeper, and 1 Seeker in play, you win the game.

"This is our last chance -
my lasty chance-
to "win the Quidditch cup.""
-Oliver Wood
This card costs 2 less Power to play for every Beater, Chaser, Keeper, and Seeker you have in play. Do 8 damage to an opponent. Then they choose 2 of their cards in play and discard them.
Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play.

To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Choose a Character (other than a starting Character) that an opponent put into play during their last turn. Take control of that Character. If it has a Once per game ability that has already been used, use that ability.
To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Before each of your turns, draw 2 cards, then discard 1 card from your hand.
Before each of your turns, you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, until the end of your turn, card effects cannot prevent you from playing Spells.

Once per game, you may search your deck and discard pile. You may take up to 2 non-Healing Matches from your deck and/or discard pile, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.

Choose an opponent. They may discard any number of their cards from play and/or from their hand. Then, count the number of cards they have in their hand and in play. Do twice that much damage to that opponent.
Choose a non-Healing card in your discard pile other than Three Turns. Play that card without using any Actions.
Whenever a Creature does damage to you, you may prevent all but the first 1 damage.
You discard your hand. During your next turn, you may not play Adventures.
Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play.
Play this card only if you have at least 5 Lessons in play.
To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play.
If this card is discarded from your hand, you may draw a card. Choose an opponent's card in play with printed Power cost less than or equal to 3 and discard it.

If there are fewer than 3 cards under this card, whenever you discard cards from your hand, put 1 of them under this card face down.During your turn you may discard this card from play. If you do, put all cards under this card into your hand.
Do 7 damage to an opponent. If you have fewer than 10 cards in your deck, instead do 15 damage to an opponent and discard your hand.
If this card is discarded from your hand, you may draw a card.
Put a non-Healing Spell from your discard pile into your hand.
When you play this card, discard 4 cards from your hand. You may discard 1 less card for every Power you have above 3. Your opponents cannot play Adventures or Events.
Your opponent chooses 3 of their cards in play and discards them.
Your opponent may search their deck for a Lesson, reveal it, and put it into play. Then they shuffle their deck.
When you play this card, name a non-Lesson card. Whenever an opponent uses an Action to play the named card, they take 10 damage.
Play this card only if you have at least 4 Lessons in play.
To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Whenever an opponent plays a Character, they cannot use Actions or activate abilities until the end of their turn.
Your opponent lets you choose 3 of their cards in play. Return them to their owner's hand.
Your opponent may draw a card.
When you play this card, if you have at least 4 Lessons in play, you get 1 more Action this turn.

When you play this card, name a Character card. Cards that share Uniqueness with the named card cannot be played. You may use 2 Actions and discard this card from play to search your deck. You may take the named card from your deck and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.

Do 3 damage to an opponent. Then draw a card.
If this card is discarded from your hand, you may draw a card.
Count the amount of Power you have. Do that much damage to an opponent.
Choose an Item in play. Draw cards equal to the chosen Item's printed Power cost. Then each other player draws cards equal to the chosen Item's printed Power cost.
If you have at least 5 Lessons in play, whenever 1 of your Creatures does damage, it does 1 more damage.
You may reveal any number of cards from your hand. For each card type revealed, do 2 damage to an opponent.
If this card is discarded from your hand, you may draw a card. Put up to 6 non-Healing cards from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck (in any order).

Your opponent chooses 3 of their cards from their hand and/or in play and discards them. Then they may discard a Lesson from their hand. If they do, you choose 3 cards from your hand and/or in play and discard them. (If there are fewer than 3 cards, discard them all instead.)
Whenever cards are put in an opponent's deck (even if they were already in the deck), do 2 damage to them.
Your opponent lets you search your deck. You may take up to 2 Events from your deck, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your deck.
Your opponent may put up to 2 Lessons from their discard pile into their hand.
Before each of your turns, if there is an Event in play, your opponent takes 5 damage.

Choose 1 of your Wizards or Witches in play and discard it, then put a Creature from your hand into play. (You must still pay any additional costs to play the Creature.) That Creature does damage to an opponent.
When you play this card, discard any other Locations in play.
If this card is discarded from your hand, you may draw a card. Do 2 damage to an opponent. Then, if that opponent has any cards in play, they choose 1 of them and return it to its owner's hand.
Your Marauder cards need 3 less Power and 1 less Action to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches. If this means you would use fewer than 1 Action, you still use 1 Action.)
Your opponent discards 3 cards from their hand that share a Lesson type with a card under this card.
Your opponent may draw 3 cards or do 3 damage to you.
Play this card only if you have at least 4 Lessons in play.

Choose a card type that an opponent has in play. Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a card of the chosen card type, then discard all revealed cards. That opponent reveals cards from the top of their deck until they reveal a card of the chosen card type, then they discard all revealed cards.
You may play this card without using an Action if you have won a Match this turn. You get 2 more Actions this turn. You may only play 1 Victory Party each turn.
Whenever your opponent makes progress towards winnning a Match, increase your progress by half that amount, rounded up. (If both players would win the Match, your opponent is the winner.)
Discard the top card of your deck. If it shares a card type with a card an opponent has in play, you may choose one of those cards and discard it. Then draw a card.
Choose up to 2 Beaters, Chasers, Keepers, and/or Seekers in play and return them to their owners' hands.
Choose a non-Lesson card type. During your opponent's next turn, they cannot play cards of the chosen type.
Do 1 damage to each Creature (even your own).
If this card is discarded from play, put it into your hand.
You may use an Action to draw 3 cards, then put 2 cards from your hand on top of your deck in any order.
Discard any number of cards from your hand. Draw that many cards plus 1.
Do 6 damage to an opponent or choose a Character in play and discard it.
Count the number of Lessons in your discard pile. Until the end of your turn, your cards need that much less Power to play. (You still need at least 1 Power that matches.)
Whenever this card does damage to an opponent, you may choose a Creature in play. Do 1 damage to it.
Choose an opponent's card in play and return it to its owner's hand. If you have at least 3 Lessons in your discard pile, instead shuffle it into its owner's deck.
When you play this card, discard any other Location from play.
Whenever a Creature is discarded from play, you may do 2 damage to an opponent or draw a card.

Shuffle up to 3 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck. If you have at least 3 Lessons in your discard pile, instead shuffle up to 8 non-Healing cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Do 4 damage to an opponent. If you have at least 3 Lessons in your discard pile, instead do 6 damage to an opponent and draw a card.
To play this card, discard 1 of your Lessons from play. Whenever an opponent uses an Action to play a Lesson, do 2 damage to them.
When you play this card, you may put up to 3 damage counters on it. If you do, do that much damage divided as you choose among any number of creatures.
Do 4 damage to your opponent. You may also choose a Creature in play and do 4 damage to it.
The winner may draw 2 cards. The loser takes 8 damage.
Whenever a player takes damage, they may discard any number of cards from their hand. They prevent that much damage.
If at least 1 of your Creatures dealt damage to an opponent this turn, choose a non-Healing Character in play and shuffle it into its owner's deck.
Look at the top 4 cards of your deck, then put them on the top and/or bottom of your deck in any order. If you have at least 3 Lessons in your discard pile, draw 2 cards.
'... he glanced around, saw Malfoy on his tail ...'

Choose two of the following, then shuffle this card into your deck: Look at the top 2 cards of an opponent's deck, then put them back in any order. Prevent the next 1 damage you would take on an opponent's next turn. An opponent discards a card from their hand.
Choose an opponent's card in play. They may discard the card from play. If they don't, draw 2 cards and you get 1 more Action this turn.
All opponents reveal any cards they draw during their draw step.
Do 4 damage to an opponent. During that opponent's next turn, they can't use Actions to play Creatures.
Choose an opponent's Creature in play and do 3 damage to it. If you have any cards in hand, choose and discard 1 of them.
Once during each of your turns, whenever 1 of your Creatures does damage to an opponent, you may return it to its owner's hand.
You may put a Creature from your discard pile into your hand. If you have at least 3 Lessons in your discard pile, you may play that Creature without using an Action.
Whenever you search your deck, you may draw a card.
During your turn, you may discard this card from play. If you do, draw cards equal to the number of cards you discarded from your hand this turn or any opponents' last turn.
Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a or Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.
Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a or Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.
Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a or Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.
Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a or Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.
Before your turn, discard this card from play. If you do, you may search your deck for a or Lesson and put it into play. Then shuffle your deck.
